meanings.definition: The abandonment or renunciation of a religious or political belief.
meanings.sent1: After his apostasy, he no longer believed in the teachings of his former religion.
meanings.sent2: The community was shocked by her apostasy from the established political party.
meanings.sent3: His apostasy from the church led to some awkward family dinners.
meanings.sent4: The apostasy of the leader caused a ripple effect throughout the organization.
meanings.sent5: The apostasy was a clear sign of his change in beliefs.

meanings.definition: An act of refusing to continue to follow, obey, or recognize a religious faith.
meanings.sent1: The apostasy of the group members caused a divide in the congregation.
meanings.sent2: She faced consequences for her apostasy when she stopped attending the religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: His sudden apostasy made him the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: The apostasy was like a door closing on his previous religious life.
meanings.sent5: The apostasy was a bold statement of his independence.
